content.description: Step up on stacked blocks under a low roof.  Twist your body out from under the roof to the right.  Step up and duck and twist under the second roof back to the Left.  Desperately hand traverse while laybacking the steep two inch wide rail, until you can get your feet under you.  Finish it off straight up to the top.
content.protection: Gear and slung boulders needed to set up.
content.location: Left Side of Risque Pinnacle and near the outside corner.

content.description:
Start just left of the overhang low on the right side of the wall. Climb up to and then around the block that juts out to the left. At the ledge move left until it is possible to move up the shallow left facing inside corner.  Follow this corner to the top.

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: Long static line back to the main wall and secured by big cams.
content.location: The Blue route in the beta photo.

content.description:
Start at the crack in the middle of the face. Climb up following the obvious big crack and features.  Finish in the notch or work the face to either side to reach the top system.

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: Top system to gear. Needs to be extended 30-40 feet to the edge.
content.location: The Green route on the beta photo.

content.description:
Start under the small roof on the right side of the wall. Do a move or two to move left and around the roof. Head right toward the right side of the face. Make use of a thin crack and features on the face. Once good hands are reached continue up the face to the top.

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: A long static line to big cams and a slung boulder.
content.location: The Purple route on the beta photo

content.description:
Start at the crack in the center of the face. Climb up about 10 feet before angeling left toward the right side of the roof.Fun moved on good holds take you to the top.

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: Top system from mid and large size cams and a long static line.
content.location: The Yellow route on the beta photo.

content.description:
Begin at the crack below the center of the face.start up the crack and begin moving left across friction moves. Continue up easy ground until under the left side of the roof. Use features of the missing chunk of rock to surmount the roof. Finish up the left side of the wall to the high point of the wall.

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: Top system from gear and a slung boulder. A long static line was still required.
content.location: The Red route on the beta picture.

content.description:
Start just left of the overhang on the right side of the wall. Work up to the left facing block. Aim for a spot on the ledge about 2 feet from the left edge. Work the clean face using  thin feet and hands until the next horizontal crack is reached. Head to the top on straightforward holds.              

Risqué Pinnacle climb starts

Risqué Pinnacle
content.protection: A long static rope back to large cams and a slung boulder.
content.location: The Pink route on the beta photo.

content.description: Once surmounting the opening moves you will be cruising up the arete.  The crux could be bypassed to drop the grade by starting on top of the boulders to the right.  The starting handhold is a quarter inch lip that is barely reachable by a 5'7” tall person.  Crank up on the handhold and gain a foothold to the right.  Move towards the arete below the small roof and then cruise up the arete to the top.
content.protection: Gear and slung boulders needed for the anchor
content.location: Right hand end of the main face of Risque Pinnacle.

content.description:
The Risque Pinnacle is located 100 feet from the West end of the Way Down Rocks outcrops. From the top it appears as a large buttress jutting out from the flat topped top of the cliff band. This wall is North Facing but open and Airy. There are 6 distinct routes in the the 5.4 to 5.7 range. Aside from a little lichen the rock is clean and solid. There is still the opportunity to put new routes on both the left and right sides for those who find exploring a rewarding effort.              

Risqué Pinnacle
